result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole J Pietsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

**AMENDED 12-8-2014:  Defendant must attend 1 self-help meeting per day until job is obtained, and then 5 meetings per week for the first year of probation.  Must provide signed proof of attendance.**
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes:
**AMENDED 12-8-2014:  Balance of conditional time is stayed effective immediately.**
**AMENDED 10-21-2014: DEFENDANT CAN BE RELEASED FROM RCJ UPON PLACEMENT IN HALFWAY HOUSE.  AGENT WILL NEED TO CONFIRM PLACEMENT PRIOR TO RELEASE.**
Defendant is to participate in the ZCI program.  Once ZCI program is completed, balance is stayed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Balance of conditional time is stayed effective immediately.  Defendant must attend 1 self-help meeting per day until job is obtained, and then 5 meetings per week for the first year of probation.  Must provide signed proof of attendance.

Defendant Nicole J Pietsch in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant Nicole J Pietsch in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Jennifer Tanck-Adams.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Atty McClendon req that defendant be released.
State takes no position.
BTC:  Amend JOC to stay balance of conditional time.  Defendant is to attend 1 self-help mtg/day.  Once defendant obtains job, 5 mtg/wk for first year of probation.
BTC:  Jail figures out workers credit.  Req for Huber is denied.
Defendant asking for workers credit and huber.
BTC:  Defendant can be released from RCJ upon placement in halfway house.  Agent will need to confirm placement prior to release.

Defendant Nicole J Pietsch in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant Nicole J Pietsch in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defense requests review of sentence as she is not eligible for ZCI Program.  Defense requests release.
BTC:  Amend JOC to reflect that defendant can be released from RCJ upon placement in halfway house.  PO will need to confirm placement prior to release.
Hearing on October 21, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's
Status conference on September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
NG plea entered.
Reading waived.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Nicole J Pietsch in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant Nicole J Pietsch in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim, store.    Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Nicole J Pietsch in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Nicole J Pietsch in custody.  James D. Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.    Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.
